thread.title: Vucevic scores 18, Magic top Brazilian team Flamengo 90-73
thread.title_full: Vucevic scores 18, Magic top Brazilian team Flamengo 90-73

author: wtopstaff
title: Vucevic scores 18, Magic top Brazilian team Flamengo 90-73
text:
Home » News » Sports » NBA » Vucevic scores 18, Magic… Vucevic scores 18, Magic top Brazilian team Flamengo 90-73 By The Associated Press October 17, 2015 8:07 pm Orlando Magic's Tobias Harris goes to the basket past the defense of Brazil Flamengo's Rafael Luz, during a preseason basketball game as part of the NBA Global Games Rio 2015 at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015. (AP Photo/Felipe Dana) 
RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Nikola Vucevic scored 18 points, Shabazz Napier added 14 and the Orlando Magic took command early on the way to beating the Brazilian club Flamengo 90-73 on Saturday night as part of the NBA Global Games. 
The Magic led 13-2 early and eventually built a 28-point edge. Victor Oladipo scored 13 for Orlando and Evan Fournier added 10 for the Magic. 
Marcelo “Marcelinho” Machado, a longtime Brazilian star and a veteran of international play, led Flamengo with 17 points. 
MAGIC: Orlando held the Brazilian club to 32 percent shooting, while connecting on 49 percent of its own shots. … Vucevic addressed the raucous crowd before the game, thanking them for their hospitality on Orlando’s visit. … Backup C Greg Stiemsma made his preseason debut, checking in during the fourth quarter. … Magic coach Scott Skiles said he was happy with the way his team handled the trip. “We knew it was going to be a good environment to play in,” Skiles said. 
FLAMENGO: It was the second straight season that Flamengo — which plays in Brazil’s top league — lost to the Magic. Flamengo went winless on a three-game preseason NBA tour last year against Orlando, Phoenix and Memphis. 
SKILES CAUTIOUS: Skiles kept Aaron Gordon (soreness) and Elfrid Payton (hamstring) out of the game, though neither injury issue is considered serious. 
UP NEXT: Orlando returns home Wednesday for its next-to-last preseason contest, playing host to New Orleans. Topics:
